title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet
name: TW Cheatsheet
author: Mario Pietsch
text:
{"tiddlers":{"$:/Cheatsheet CodeML":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet CodeML","created":"20220821210906207","modified":"20230115190117755","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"``` multi-line code block ```"},"$:/Cheatsheet Comment":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Comment","created":"20220822123735465","modified":"20230115185939861","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"there is some text "},"$:/Cheatsheet CS":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet CS","created":"20220821220043774","modified":"20230115185948472","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} @@.myStyle * List One * List Two @@"},"$:/Cheatsheet Custom Widget":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Custom Widget","code-body":"yesx","created":"20230501090727318","modified":"20230501091354729","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"\widget $$my-widget(attribute:"Default value") This is the widget, and the attribute is: ''<>'' \end <<.from-version "5.3.0">> Custom widget is a <<.def "custom widget">> is a special kind of [[procedure|Procedures]] that can be called using the same syntax as widgets. Custom widgets can also be used to override built-in ~JavaScript widgets to customise their behaviour. Custom widgets are usually defined with the pragma: `\widget`: <$$my-widget attribute="xxxx"/> "},"$:/Cheatsheet DL":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet DL","created":"20220821192659739","modified":"20230115185958627","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} ; term : definition "},"$:/Cheatsheet Functions":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Functions","created":"20230501093733923","modified":"20230501094251689","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"\function my-function(parameter:"2") [multiply[1.5]] \end <<.from-version "5.3.0">> A function <<.def function>> is a named snippet of text containing a [[Filter Expression]]. Functions can have named parameters which are available within the function as variables. Functions are usually defined with the `\function` pragma ------------- 2 * 1.5 = <>
6 * 1.5 = <>"},"$:/Cheatsheet HL":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet HL","created":"20220822121844102","modified":"20230115190006611","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"""" line 1 line 2 """ Standard text using an HTML `BR` tag
Next line"},"$:/Cheatsheet HR":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet HR","created":"20220822122255279","modified":"20230115190014403","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"The three dashes `---` need to be in their own line with _no_ leading or trailing spaces --- or you can use the HTML `
` element
which has no such restrictions "},"$:/Cheatsheet HTML":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet HTML","created":"20220821220043774","modified":"20230115190023673","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"

A h2 heading

Some text in a paragraph

  • List level 1
    1. Ordered list level 2
  • List level 1 element 2
"},"$:/Cheatsheet MCall":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet MCall","code-body":"yes","created":"20220822124925667","modified":"20230115190043040","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":" \import [[$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition]] <> <>"},"$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition","code-body":"yes","created":"20220822124422967","modified":"20230115190043035","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":" \define sayhi(name:"Bugs Bunny") Hi, I'm <$text text=<<__name__>>/> \define sayhi(name:"Bugs Bunny") Hi, I'm <$text text=<<__name__>>/> \end macro definitions are invisible"},"$:/Cheatsheet ML":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet ML","created":"20220821204921376","modified":"20230115190052591","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} # ordered #* unordered #*; term #*: definition"},"$:/Cheatsheet OL":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet OL","created":"20220821191227008","modified":"20230115185805564","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} # item 1 # item 2 ## level two ### level three"},"$:/Cheatsheet PlainText":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet PlainText","created":"20221025130723157","modified":"20230115185753273","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Some plain text"},"$:/Cheatsheet PM":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet PM","created":"20220822141712911","modified":"20230115190100431","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"In order to display Tiddlers (usually the text field), the ~WikiText parser reads and interprets the content and applies ~WikiText rules. The parser has three modes: * ''pragma mode'' - the parser will recognise only "pragma mode" ~WikiText punctuation. eg `\import` * ''block mode'' - the parser will recognise only "block mode" ~WikiText punctuation. eg `! heading` *''inline mode'' - the parser will recognise only "inline mode" ~WikiText. eg: `''bold''`"},"$:/Cheatsheet Pragmas":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Pragmas","created":"20230501091658586","modified":"20230501100847525","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"A <<.def pragma>> is a special component of WikiText that provides control over the way the remaining text is parsed. Pragmas occupy lines that start with `\`. The following pragmas are available: * Pragma: `\define` * Pragma: `\function` * Pragma: `\import` * Pragma: `\parameters` * Pragma: `\procedure` * Pragma: `\rules` * Pragma: `\whitespace` * Pragma: `\widget` "},"$:/Cheatsheet Procedures":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Procedures","created":"20230501093211568","modified":"20230501094258932","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"\procedure my-procedure(parameter:"Default value") This is the procedure, and the parameter is: ''<>''. \end <<.from-version "5.3.0">> A procedure is a named snippet of text. They are typically defined with the `\procedure` pragma: The name wrapped in double angled [[brackets|Brackets]] is used a shorthand way of [[transcluding|Transclusion]] the snippet. Each of these <<.def "procedure calls">> can supply a different set of parameters: -------- <> <> "},"$:/Cheatsheet Quotes":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Quotes","created":"20220821205428297","modified":"20230115190109205","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} > blockquote >> level two >>> level three"},"$:/Cheatsheet QuotesMIX":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet QuotesMIX","created":"20220821210008513","modified":"20230115185753277","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} <<< paragraph 1 > inner quote, level 1 >> inner quote, level 2 some more text <<< ref: [[https://tiddlywiki.com/#Block Quotes in WikiText]]"},"$:/Cheatsheet QuotesML":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet QuotesML","created":"20220821205712620","modified":"20230115185817058","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} <<< paragraph 1 paragraph 2 <<<"},"$:/Cheatsheet Table":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Table","created":"20220821215553807","modified":"20230115185825531","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"|utilityClass anotherClass|k |This is a caption |c |Header|Header|h |Cell1 |Cell2 | |Cell3 |Cell3 | |Footer|Footer|f"},"$:/Cheatsheet TB":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet TB","created":"20220822142452539","modified":"20230115185834405","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"~WikiText can include blocks of text that are rendered with an explicit ~ContentType like this: $$$image/svg+xml $$$ "},"$:/Cheatsheet Transclusion":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Transclusion","created":"20220822134140546","modified":"20230115185847145","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"You can incorporate the content of one tiddler within another using the Transclusion notation: * `{{MyTiddler}}` transcludes the content of a single tiddler * `{{MyTiddler||TemplateTitle}}` displays the tiddler through a specified ~TemplateTiddler * `{{||TemplateTitle}}` displays the specified template tiddler without altering the currentTiddler variable You can also use a ~TextReference instead of a tiddler title: * `{{MyTiddler!!field}}` transcludes a specified field of a tiddler * `{{!!field}}` transcludes a specified field of the current tiddler * `{{MyTiddler##index}}` transcludes a specified indexed property of a ~DataTiddlers * `{{##index}}` transcludes a specified indexed property of the current ~DataTiddlers"},"$:/Cheatsheet UL":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet UL","created":"20220821192058829","modified":"20230115185855339","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"{{$:/Cheatsheet PlainText}} * item 1 * item 2 ** level two *** level three"},"$:/Cheatsheet Variable":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Variable","code-body":"yes","created":"20220822140007979","modified":"20230115190043040","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Variables can be defined with [[macro definitions|$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition]], or the widgets `<$set ...>`, `<$vars ...>` or `<$let ...>`. For ''new code'' use the ''let-widget'', because it is the latest. This example uses the set-widget so the cheat sheet can also be used with old wikis. For example: <$set name="targetTiddler" value="$:/Cheatsheet Variable"> <$button message="tm-navigate" to=<> >Open tiddler: <> "},"$:/Cheatsheet Widget":{"title":"$:/Cheatsheet Widget","code-body":"yes","created":"20220822135537754","modified":"20230115185931451","tags":"[[Wikitext Cheatsheet]]","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Widgets provide rich functionality within WikiText. They have the same syntax as HTML elements, but the tag name always starts with `$`. For example: <$button message="tm-navigate" to="$:/Cheatsheet Widget">Open tiddler: $:/Cheatsheet Widget "},"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/history":{"title":"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/history","text":"V 0.1.1 2023.05.05 * fix type in bold formatting docs V 0.1.0 2023.05.02 * initial release "},"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/license":{"title":"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/license","license-text":"https://opensource.org/license/BSD-3-clause/","text":"[[Cheatsheet|https://wikilabs.github.io/#cheatsheet]] (c) Mario Pietsch - 2023- [[https://opensource.org/license/BSD-3-clause/]] "},"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/Buttons/show-wiki-syntax":{"title":"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/Buttons/show-wiki-syntax","caption":"{{$:/core/images/tip}} TW Syntax","created":"20230502110625798","description":"Show Wikitext Cheetsheet","modified":"20230502111233925","tags":"$:/tags/PageControls","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"\whitespace trim <$button message="tm-modal" param="Wikitext Cheatsheet" tooltip="Show Wikitext Cheetsheet" aria-label="Show Wikitext Cheetsheet" class=<>> <$list filter="[match[yes]]"> {{$:/core/images/tip}} <$list filter="[match[yes]]"> <$text text="cheatsheet"/> "},"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/readme":{"title":"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/readme","text":"This plugin adds the [[Wikitext Cheatsheet]] overview to your wiki. ''Cheatsheet Settings'' This plugin adds 2 new "Show Wikitext Cheatsheet" buttons and an editor-shortcut to your wiki * A "Cheatsheet" button is added as a "page button" * A "Cheatsheet" button is added to the edit toolbars .. Shortcut F1 "},"$:/config/ShortcutInfo/show-cheatsheet":{"title":"$:/config/ShortcutInfo/show-cheatsheet","created":"20230501131245142","modified":"20230501131711792","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Show Wikitext Cheetsheet Modal"},"$:/config/shortcuts-mac/show-cheatsheet":{"title":"$:/config/shortcuts-mac/show-cheatsheet","created":"20230501131245143","modified":"20230501131707404","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"meta-shift-H"},"$:/config/shortcuts-not-mac/show-cheatsheet":{"title":"$:/config/shortcuts-not-mac/show-cheatsheet","created":"20230501131245144","modified":"20230501132227745","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"F1"},"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/toolbar/show":{"title":"$:/plugins/wikilabs/cheatsheet/toolbar/show","caption":"Cheatsheet","condition":"[!has[type]] [type[text/vnd.tiddlywiki]]","condition-disabled":"[[$:/temp/cheatsheet/disabled]get[state-disabled]else[no]]","created":"20230501105610496","description":"Show WikiText Cheatsheet","icon":"$:/core/images/tip","list-before":"$:/core/ui/EditorToolbar/bold","modified":"20230501132436406","shortcuts":"((show-cheatsheet))","tags":"$:/tags/EditorToolbar","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-modal" $param="Wikitext Cheatsheet" prefix="''" suffix="''" /> "},"Wikitext Cheatsheet":{"title":"Wikitext Cheatsheet","created":"20220821184022101","modified":"20230501135238087","tags":"WikiText","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":" \define baseURL() https://tiddlywiki.com/# \define exportMeButton(btnText:"Export Me & Tagged") \whitespace trim <$let me=<> > <$set name=exportFilter filter="[tag] []"> <$tiddler tiddler="$:/core/templates/exporters/JsonFile"> <$button class="tc-btn-download" > <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-download-file" $param=<> exportFilter=<> filename={{{ [addsuffix{!!extension}] }}}/> <$text text=<<__btnText__>>/> \end \define link(text tid) <$link to={{{ [<__tid__>] }}} ><<__text__>> \define extLink(text tid) ] [<__tid__>] +[join[]] }}} rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><<__text__>> \define .xL(text tid) \whitespace trim <$let macro={{{ [<__tid__>is[tiddler]then[link]else[extLink]] }}}> <$macrocall $name=<> text=<<__text__>> tid=<<__tid__>> /> \end \define .t(tid) <$transclude tiddler=<<__tid__>> mode=block/> \define .cb(title) <$macrocall $name="copy-to-clipboard-above-right" src={{{ [<__title__>get[text]] }}}/> <$codeblock code={{{ [<__title__>get[text]] }}}/> \end | Rendered Result | Example Markup |h | how the example markup renders | what to enter as tiddler text | |>| ! <<.xL "Basic Text Formatting" "Formatting in WikiText">> | |''bold'' |`''bold''` (two single-quotes) | |//italics// |`//italics//` | |''//bold italics//'' |`''//bold italics//''` | |__underscore__ |`__underscore__` | |~~strikethrough~~ |`~~strikethrough~~` | |super^^script^^ |`super^^script^^` | |sub,,script,, |`sub,,script,,` | |@@highlight@@ |`@@highlight@@` | |n--dash |`n--dash` | |m---dash |`m---dash` | |>| ! <<.xL "Headings" "Headings in WikiText">> | |

Heading 1

|`! Heading 1` | |

Heading 2

|`! Heading 2` | |

Heading 3

|`! Heading 3` | |

Heading 4

|`! Heading 4` | |
Heading 5
|`! Heading 5` | |
Heading 6
|`! Heading 6` | |>| ! <<.xL "Lists" "Lists in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Ordered Lists" "Lists in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet OL">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet OL">> | |>| <<.xL "Unordered Lists" "Lists in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet UL">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet UL">> | |>| <<.xL "Definition Lists" "Definitions in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet DL">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet DL">> | |>| <<.xL "Mixed Lists" "Lists in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet ML">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet ML">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Blockquotes" "Block Quotes in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Nested Blockquotes" "Block Quotes in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Quotes">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Quotes">> | |>| <<.xL "Muli-line Blockquotes" "Block Quotes in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet QuotesML">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet QuotesML">> | |>| <<.xL "Mixed Blockquotes" "Block Quotes in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet QuotesMIX">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet QuotesMIX">>| |>| ! <<.xL "Code / Monospaced Text" "Code Blocks in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Inline Code" "Code Blocks in WikiText">> | |`monospaced text` |<$codeblock code="`monospaced text`" /> | |`` `show backticks` `` |<$codeblock code="`` `show backticks` ``" /> | |>| <<.xL "Code Block" "Code Blocks in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet CodeML">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet CodeML">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Links" "Linking in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Internal Links" "Linking in WikiText">> | |<<.xL "CamelCase" "CamelCase">> |`CamelCase` | |[[Tiddler Title]] |`[[Tiddler Title]]` | |[[Pretty Link|Tiddler Title]] |`[[Pretty Link|Tiddler Title]]` | |>| <<.xL "Avoid Wikification" "Linking in WikiText">> | |~WikiText |`~WikiText` -- a leading tilde ~ prevents automatic links | |>| <<.xL "External Links" "Linking in WikiText">> | |>| A valid URL is automatically rendered as an external link | |https://tiddlywiki.com |`https://tiddlywiki.com` | |[[Pretty External Link|https://tiddlywiki.com]] |`[[Pretty External Link|https://tiddlywiki.com]]` | |[[Talk TiddlyWiki Forum|https://talk.tiddlywiki.org]] |`[[Talk TiddlyWiki Forum|https://talk.tiddlywiki.org]]` | |>| <<.xL "Filesystem Links" "Linking in WikiText">> | |>| You can, of course, use file system links both as plain or pretty links | |''Windows Network Path'' |`[[file://///server/share]]` | |''Windows Local'' |`[[file:///c:/folder/file]]` | |''Linux/Unix Local'' |`[[file:///folder/file]]` | |''Relative Path (Subfolder)'' |`[[folder/file]]` | |>| ! <<.xL "Images" "Images in WikiText">> | |>| In general, image files should be external to a ~TiddlyWiki. | |[img[https://tiddlywiki.com/favicon.ico]] |`[img[https://tiddlywiki.com/favicon.ico]]` | |[img[An explanatory tooltip|https://tiddlywiki.com/favicon.ico]] |`[img[An explanatory tooltip|https://tiddlywiki.com/favicon.ico]]` | |>| ! <<.xL "Tables" "Tables in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Table">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Table">>| |>| ! <<.xL "Custom Styles" "Styles and Classes in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet CS">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet CS">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Hard Linebreaks" "Hard Linebreaks in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet HL">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet HL">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Horizontal Rule" "Horizontal Rules in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet HR">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet HR">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Comments" "HTML in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Comment">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Comment">>| |>| ! <<.xL "Typed Blocks" "Typed Blocks in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet TB">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet TB">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Embedded HTML" "HTML in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet HTML">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet HTML">> | |>| ! <<.xL "HTML Entities" "HTML Entities">> | |™ £ or € |`™ £ or €` | |>| ! <<.xL "Procedures" "Procedures">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Procedures">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Procedures">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Functions" "Functions">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Functions">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Functions">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Macros" "Macros in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Macro Definition" "Macro Definitions in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet MDefinition">> | |>| <<.xL "Macro Calls" "Macro Calls in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet MCall">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet MCall">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Transclusions" "Transclusion in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Transclusion">> |The [[$:/Cheatsheet Transclusion]] tiddler on the left side is transcluded into the table using the <<.xL "transclusion-widget" "TranscludeWidget">>

`<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Transclusion">>` | |>| ! <<.xL "Widgets" "Widgets in WikiText">> | |>| <<.xL "Basic Widgets" "Widgets in WikiText">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Widget">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Widget">> | |>| <<.xL "Custom Widgets" "Custom Widgets">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Custom Widget">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Custom Widget">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Variables" "Variables">> | |<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Variable">> |<<.cb "$:/Cheatsheet Variable">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Parser Modes" "WikiText Parser Modes">> | |>|<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet PM">> | |>| ! <<.xL "Pragmas" "Pragmas">> | |>|<<.t "$:/Cheatsheet Pragmas">> | "}}}
